entry.title: Emergency-Chat-System
entry.content:
Web App Development Update: First Phase Preview

I am excited to share the progress of our app, currently in development. While it’s still in its early stages, I am showcasing the first-phase version of our application.

At this stage, I have implemented a basic Chat Room System. In the future, I will collaborate with other 4 software Engineering students to expand this into a full-fledged Emergency Chat System that includes a variety of powerful features such as:

  • Ability to share user status
  • Options for both private and public chats
  • Search functionality and Emergency Alerts
  • An Admin page for performing speed tests
  • Crucially, we will also implement:
    • Priority Messaging
    • Location Sharing
    • Offline Messaging Support
    • Emergency Contacts

This is just the beginning, and I am excited to continue developing features that enhance communication during emergencies. Stay tuned for more updates!

First Phase video:

To be Continue~

entry.title: Automating My Personal Website-TEST
entry.content:
Display automating Solution: Deploy your website by Editing content in Notion.

  1. Edit Personal Content in Notion
  2. Pingo upload banner_img and index_img for
  3. run github scripts to github pages

In this post, I want to share how I’ve automated the deployment of my personal website, streamlining content updates using Notion and GitHub Pages.

The Automation Workflow:

  1. Edit Content in Notion:

    I manage my website’s content through Notion. Whenever I want to update my personal content, I simply edit it in Notion, ensuring everything stays organized and easy to modify.

  2. Upload Banner and Index Images:

    For visual updates, I use Pingo to upload the banner images and index images that will appear on the website. This step ensures the site remains visually engaging and updated with fresh images.

  3. Run GitHub Scripts:

    Once the content and images are updated, I execute GitHub scripts that automatically deploy the latest version of the website to GitHub Pages, making the entire process seamless.

With this automation setup, I can easily update my website without needing to manually redeploy it. It’s fast, efficient, and allows me to focus on improving the content rather than worrying about technical deployments.

Video Display:

entry.title: GRIT-model-with-GPT4
entry.content:
• Github_link:
ShangChienLiu/GritAndGPT4
ShangChienLiu
•
Created: 2023-12-13T18:13:17Z

Overview:

GritAndGPT4 is a project designed to harness the capabilities of the GRIT (Generative Region-to-Text Transformer for Object Understanding) model to capture object descriptions. These descriptions are then processed by GPT-4, which generates safety suggestions to enhance driver awareness.

Figure

Coordinates and descriptions from GRIT model

Image size: 1920x1080
List of object coordinates [x1, y1, x2, y2] and object descriptions:
[67, 123, 284, 311] the car is silver in color
[209, -236, 359, -88] a business promotional sign
[348, 136, 710, 387] a car on a street
[412, 283, 528, 388] tire on the car
[295, 106, 948, 420] the car is silver
[-288, 80, -238, 135] red and white stop sign
[-885, -535, 64, 281] green tree on the sidewalk
[-954, 234, -263, 534] the bushes are green
[-906, 253, 893, 523] the black paved road
[-417, 273, -172, 533] red paint on the curb
[-184, 180, -127, 272] motorcycle on the sidewalk

Safety Suggestions

Please be cautious of the car on the street ahead and the motorcycle parked on the sidewalk. Don’t forget to stop at the red and white stop sign up ahead, and watch out for red paint on the curb as you drive.

Figure

Coordinates and descriptions from GRIT model

Image size: 1920x1080
List of object coordinates [x1, y1, x2, y2] and object descriptions:
[-310, 85, 157, 488] white van on the road
[-136, 234, -19, 291] license plate on the car
[471, 47, 771, 534] person riding a motorcycle
[-747, 30, -504, 522] a man on a motorcycle
[-888, -442, -432, -190] a white sign with red letters
[-735, 114, -525, 305] the shirt is white
[501, 143, 738, 350] a red shirt on a man
[-669, -207, -443, 102] the blue sign on the building
[-550, 370, -297, 536] double yellow lines on the road
[232, 152, 347, 362] person riding a motorcycle
[547, 48, 652, 153] the helmet is black
[-739, 388, -635, 441] license plate on the motorcycle
[-956, 158, -779, 404] a white truck on the road
[382, -272, 740, 25] a tall green glass building
[-929, 56, 936, 525] people riding scooters
[-394, 185, -295, 267] the car is black
[52, -99, 373, -28] signs on the building
[-676, 29, -579, 122] white helmet on the man
[754, -129, 954, 120] palm tree behind the bus
[-755, 292, -533, 534] the motorcycle is black and white
[-959, -524, 949, 531] a city street scene
[356, 110, 521, 409] person riding a motorcycle

Safety Suggestions

Keep an eye on the white van and the white truck on the road. Be cautious of multiple motorcycles and scooters around you. Pay attention to double yellow lines on the road, as they indicate no passing or crossing over to another lane. Also, stay aware of pedestrians who may be near signs and buildings along the city street.

Figure

Coordinates and descriptions from GRIT model

Image size: 1920x1080
List of object coordinates [x1, y1, x2, y2] and object descriptions:
[193, 87, 256, 270] the man is wearing a green shirt
[297, 84, 575, 262] black and white car parked on street
[664, 3, 782, 510] the metal sign post
[-953, 103, 813, 535] the road is clear
[441, -13, 507, 74] red and white sign
[-485, 332, -257, 535] yellow lines on the road
[-233, 105, -176, 196] a red and white sign
[198, 110, 250, 169] the green shirt the man is wearing
[-955, 144, -668, 413] chain link fence on side of road
[-278, 169, -243, 227] orange and white cone
[-954, -534, -386, 275] the tree is green
[-957, -527, 954, 522] the trees lining the road
[-428, -386, -103, 238] tree with green leaves

Safety Suggestions

Drive cautiously and pay attention to the yellow lines on the road. Keep an eye out for the orange and white cone up ahead, as well as the man in a green shirt near the black and white car parked on the street. Also, be aware of potential pedestrians near trees lining both sides of the road.

entry.title: FDT5-Model
entry.content:
• Github_link:
ShangChienLiu/FDT5_Model
ShangChienLiu
•
Created: 2023-12-13T18:05:44Z

Overview:

The FDT5_Model is a system capable of generating engaging questions from specified locations, represented by a vehicle’s GPS coordinates and four side street-view images captured by on-car cameras. We utilize data from the Google Street View dataset and craft prompts based on the address obtained through reverse geocoding of the GPS coordinates, complemented by captions from street-view images generated by an advanced image captioning model. This repository demonstrates street views and coordinates from various locations, including USA_Pittsburgh, USA_Orlando, and USA_NewYork, to create engaging questions.

Demo Video:

Four side images USA_NewYork:

coordinate 40.73055,-74.001715

5 generated Engaging Questions:

  • “How do you think the streets around us compare to other cities you’ve visited?”
  • “Can you spot any local businesses or cafes nearby? How do you think these restaurants contribute to the overall atmosphere and energy of New York City?”
  • “As we drive along this busy city street, can you spot any architectural styles or designs that stand out to you?”
  • “Have you noticed the diverse range of shops and restaurants in this area? Did you know that New York City has over 500 hotels and restaurants?”
  • “Have you ever noticed the history of this neighborhood in New York City? How do you think the traffic flow in your hometown compared to other cities you’ve visited?”

Four side images USA_Orlando:

coordinate 28.541323,-81.380703

5 generated Engaging Questions:

  • “How do you think the streets around us compare to other cities you’ve visited?”
  • “Can you spot any local businesses or restaurants that you’re excited to visit during your stay in Orlando? Do you find it appealing?”
  • “As we drive along this bustling city street, can you spot any unique architectural features or architecture that stand out to you?”
  • “Have you ever taken a ride in a neighborhood like Orlando? The city is known for its lush landscaping and cultural diversity.”
  • “Are you familiar with the history of Orlando’s landmarks and buildings in the area? Orlando is known for its vibrant atmosphere, a vibrant, and many museums and restaurants.”

Four side images USA_Pittsburgh:

coordinate 40.440309,-80.0

5 generated Engaging Questions:

  • “How do you think the streets around us compare to other cities you’ve visited?”
  • “Can you spot any local businesses or cafes nearby? How do you think these restaurants contribute to the overall atmosphere and energy of Pittsburgh?”
  • “As we drive along this bustling city street, can you spot any unique architectural features or architecture that stand out to you?”
  • “Have you noticed the diverse range of shops and restaurants in this area? The busy city street to our south has a diverse cuisine. Can you guess what kind of cuisine is occupying?”
  • “Have you ever taken a ride in Pittsburgh before? We’re currently in the heart of the city.”

Overview:

The News-Facts-Explanation Website is a web application that offers users a platform to access news sentences along with detailed explanations. Users have the option to score these explanations or ask questions about them. A Large Language Model (LLM), like GPT-4, refines the explanations based on user feedback. This website aims to collect human feedback data to survey whether LLMs can generate better explanations when collaborating with humans.

entry.title: Hello-AI-World!
entry.content:
Origin of ‘Hello AI World’:

Similar to ‘Hello World,’ ‘Hello AI World’ can be introduced as an initial step in AI programming. It represents the entry point into the world of artificial intelligence, symbolizing the beginning of a journey into AI development.

Reasons for Using ‘Hello AI World’:

  • Testing AI Environments: As a primary exercise in AI programming, it’s essential to output a simple message like ‘Hello AI World.’ This ensures the basic functioning of AI development environments, such as Python with AI libraries or AI platforms.
  • Verifying AI Model Integration: Before advancing to complex AI algorithms, confirming the proper integration of AI models and tools is crucial. A primary output like ‘Hello AI World’ is a straightforward test for this integration.
  • Introduction to AI Concepts: For beginners, ‘Hello AI World’ can be an introductory step to understanding how AI models interact with programming languages and how simple outputs can be generated through AI systems.

Impact on AI Programming Efficiency:

Just like in traditional programming, starting with ‘Hello AI World’ in AI development can significantly enhance the efficiency of the overall process. It helps quickly identify issues in AI environment setup and model integration, streamlining the development process.

In summary:

‘Hello AI World’ could become a standard first step in AI programming, analogous to ‘Hello World’ in traditional programming, symbolizing the initial interaction with AI technologies and serving practical purposes in AI development.

entry.title: 7th-Hackathon-Taiwan-Junior
entry.content:
• Github_link:
ShangChienLiu/7th-Hackathon-Taiwan-Junior
ShangChienLiu
•
Created: 2023-12-13T18:15:31Z

Cover:

Overview:

The 7th-Hackathon-Taiwan-Junior project is a PHP-based web application that aims to provide a platform for offering services such as digital device rental and remote teaching, aimed at helping rural areas or economically challenged groups. Through our services, we aim to bridge the educational gap between urban and rural areas, ensuring that everyone has equal access to education.

BackGround:

In response to challenges like wealth disparity, climate change, and gender equality, the United Nations launched the “2030 Sustainable Development Goals” (SDGs) in 2015. This initiative proposed 17 core objectives for global governments and businesses to work towards sustainable development. The fourth goal emphasizes “ensuring inclusive and equitable quality education and promoting lifelong learning opportunities for all.”

Goal:

To improve the digital device deficit among disadvantaged groups and to address the challenges of learning through digital products, we plan to launch a digital resource sharing platform. This platform will provide services such as digital device rental and remote teaching, targeting rural areas or economically disadvantaged groups. Our goal is to bridge the educational gap between urban and rural areas through our services, embodying the principle that everyone deserves equal access to education.

Services:

The current challenge faced by disadvantaged students in Taiwan regarding remote learning includes a lack of devices, internet access, computer literacy, and after-school tutoring. To address this, our team has decided to develop a website offering device rental, computer usage tutorials, and online and offline tutoring courses.

For the rental aspect, we aim to provide free computer rental services to disadvantaged groups, allowing them to engage in remote learning. We will provide the devices and teach them how to learn online. Therefore, we offer computer usage courses and various tutoring sessions to assist them. These courses are also open to older adults, promoting lifelong societal learning.

Our vision extends beyond Taiwan; we aim to reach the world, ensuring that students and elders have fair access to digital learning opportunities globally.

entry.title: Donshi-Community-Mutual-Aid-Website
entry.content:
• Github_link:
ShangChienLiu/Donshi-Community-Mutual-Aid-Website
ShangChienLiu
•
Created: 2023-12-11T05:23:15Z

Overview:

The Donshi Community Mutual Aid Website is a project designed to establish a platform enabling communities to provide and receive mutual aid. Its core functionality features a website where users can post requests for assistance while others can offer help. The project aims to foster community spirit and support by connecting those in need with individuals willing to lend a hand. Its value proposition is centered around creating a centralized hub for mutual aid. This hub facilitates the exchange of help and resources within the community, utilizing a time-banking concept where time spent can be traded for services.

Motivation:

Since 2016, Taiwan has implemented the Long-Term Care 2.0 plan, a system for long-term care centered around the principle of “aging in place.” This system emphasizes three core concepts: “people-centered,” “community-based,” and “continuous care.” The goal is to establish a community-based long-term care system that provides high-quality, affordable, and widespread services.

However, in rural Taiwan, the delivery of long-term care services is limited by workforce and transportation constraints. The development of formal service provision may not keep pace with rapidly growing demand. Additionally, enabling people to live in their communities until the end of their lives involves more than just care services. Local communities might possess informal service resources that can meet these needs, and an information platform for these resources could immediately link supply and demand.

Goal:

The Donshi Community Mutual Aid Website is a project to establish a platform enabling communities to provide and receive mutual aid. Its core functionality features a website where users can post requests for assistance while others can offer help. The project aims to foster community spirit and support by connecting those in need with individuals willing to lend a hand. Its value proposition is centered around creating a centralized hub for mutual aid. This hub facilitates the exchange of help and resources within the community, utilizing a time-banking concept where time spent can be traded for services.

entry.title: English-Communication-Event
entry.content:
Unleashing Potential at Yongqi School: A Journey of Self-Discovery and Connection

Empowering Youth: The Yongqi School Initiative

Yongqi School’s Mission: Nestled in the heart of Chiayi City, Taiwan, the Yongqi School stands as a cross-disciplinary innovation platform crafted by the Chiayi City Government. This unique program aims to provide young minds a space to explore their identities, sharpen their abilities, and muster the courage to dream.

Opportunities and Growth: At Yongqi School, participants don’t just learn; they transform. They gain skills aligned with the latest trends, forge friendships with like-minded individuals, access a wealth of resources, and channel their talents and creativity into fulfilling their aspirations.

Bridging Cultures: The English Exchange Camp

The Survey and Its Findings: Our journey began with a simple question: How many high school students in Chiayi City were interested in an English-speaking exchange camp? To our delight, we discovered a keen interest among nearly 30 students.

Creating Connections: Capitalizing on this interest, we facilitated a groundbreaking interaction between National Chung Cheng University international students and Chiayi City high schoolers. The goal? To break down barriers and foster genuine connections.

Innovative Ice-Breakers and Engaging Activities

The Power of Play: Our approach was unconventional but effective. We devised English ice-breaking activities like a personality-matching tic-tac-toe game. This fun start led to a board game session, creating a relaxed atmosphere for students of different cultures to converse in English.

Music as a Universal Language: The event also included a group activity where everyone sang English songs together. This broke the ice and allowed students to engage in a shared cultural experience, further enhancing their language skills.

The Christmas Exchange: Building on Success

A Festive Follow-Up: Encouraged by the success of our initial event, we organized a second gathering – a Christmas exchange and gift-giving event. This time, we invited an even larger group of international and high school students, expanding the scope of our cultural exchange.

Question-Draw and Conversations: We introduced a new element – a question-draw session. Students drew questions at random and were encouraged to discuss them in English. This activity spurred conversation and eased the high school students’ apprehensions about speaking English with international students.

Conclusion: Cultivating Confidence and Connections

Observations and Impact: I noticed a remarkable change as the event progressed. The high school students, initially hesitant, began to communicate more freely and naturally. This was the essence of our mission at Yongqi School – to empower students to build their English communication skills and, in doing so, bridge cultural divides.

A Journey of Growth: Each activity, conversation, and song at the Yongqi School events was a step towards a more confident, connected future for these students. As they found their voices, they also discovered new facets of themselves and each other.

Event-Video：

Figure 2: Survey willing of joining our English activity

entry.title: LINE-FRESH-2021-Campus-Competition
entry.content:
Exploring Innovation: Our Journey in the LINE FRESH 2021 Campus Competition

Introduction to LINE FRESH 2021 Campus Competition

The Challenge: The LINE FRESH 2021 Campus Competition, hosted by Line – the renowned freeware app – stood as a beacon of innovation on university campuses across Taiwan. Each year, the competition revolves around a unique theme, challenging students to devise creative solutions. In 2021, the focus was on accelerating digital transformation to boost the economy amidst pandemic-induced challenges.

The Goal: Participants were encouraged to leverage LINE’s extensive digital services and open-platform technology. The aim was to support the growth of commercial districts and businesses, particularly in Taiwan’s four major local commercial areas: Taipei Shida Longquan, Yunlin Huwei Charm, Kaohsiung Liugui, and Taitung Iron Flower Commercial Districts.

Our Team’s Approach: The ‘LINE DATA’ System

The Concept: We introduced ‘LINE DATA’, a business big data analysis system designed to bridge the gap between physical retailers and their customers. Recognizing the hurdles faced by brick-and-mortar stores in precision marketing and digital advertising, our system aimed to revolutionize customer engagement.

Implementation in Taitung Iron Flower Village: We chose Taitung Iron Flower Village as our pilot area. The LINE DATA system was to organize real-world treasure hunts, using the Line API to feature unique aspects of local shops. These activities were intended to draw customers into a fun, interactive experience, offering them clues and encouraging purchases.

Learning from Meaningful Failures

Missed Opportunities: Our journey, though not successful in the preliminary round, was a valuable learning experience. We realized our plan lacked deep integration of local elements, such as Taitung’s rich musical heritage, which could have enriched the treasure hunt experience.

Lack of Detail: We failed to elaborate on specific aspects of our proposed augmented reality game and how it would actively involve local businesses.

Underutilization of LINE’s Tools: A significant oversight was our limited use of LINE’s digital tools. For instance, not incorporating Line Beacon – a tool for businesses to send real-time information to nearby visitors – was a missed chance to enhance the treasure hunt’s effectiveness.

Starting Anew: Embracing Failure as a Stepping Stone

The Takeaway: Every setback is a learning opportunity. This experience underlined the importance of integrating local culture and characteristics into our projects. It also fueled our desire to deepen our understanding of the Line app’s APIs and services.

Looking Forward: As we reflect on these lessons, our team is more motivated than ever to harness the potential of chat software like Line for impactful software services. The journey doesn’t end here; it’s a new beginning towards innovation and success.

Our Proposal Photos:

Figure 1: Title page

Figure 2: Table of Contents

Figure 3:

Propose our ideas, combining reality games and services Line APP provides to help connect tourists with local businesses.

Figure 4:

Project Planning, Target Audience, Market Analysis and Research, Objective Setting, Communication Strategy, and Technical Architecture.

Figure 5: Service Application Concept Chart

Figure 6: Technical Architecture

entry.title: Criminal-Lawyer-Recommendation-System
entry.content:
• Github_link:
ShangChienLiu/Criminal-Lawyer-Recommendation-System
ShangChienLiu
•
Created: 2023-12-13T18:19:12Z

Cover:

Overview:

The Criminal Lawyer Recommendation System is a web-based application that aims to help individuals find appropriate legal representation for criminal cases. By leveraging user-input information such as the type of crime, location, and budget, the system generates a list of recommended criminal lawyers. The application also provides detailed profiles of each recommended lawyer, including their experience, expertise, and client reviews. The project’s value proposition lies in its ability to simplify and streamline the process of finding a suitable criminal lawyer, ultimately saving users time and effort in their search for legal support.

Motivation:

Among our project members, one member has previously volunteered at the Legal Services Foundation, where they often saw many people seeking different types of legal aid. These individuals could be categorized into two groups: (1) those seeking legal consultation, and (2) those applying for aid lawyers. A common issue they faced was uncertainty about whether the consulted or aided lawyer was suitable for their case. However, as the purpose of legal aid is to provide necessary legal assistance, “recommending lawyers” is not an action legally authorized for the foundation. Thus, these individuals often struggled with which lawyer to choose. It was observed that if there was a system to recommend lawyers to the consultees, it would enable them to find a suitable lawyer more quickly and effectively. Moreover, such a system could reduce the manpower resources needed for consultations at the Legal Aid Foundation, creating a win-win situation for both the foundation and the users.

Goal:

We aspire to develop a website system that enables the general public to quickly understand their legal issues and relevant case precedents. Through a lawyer recommendation system, they can swiftly connect with suitable attorneys, thereby reducing the time and financial costs associated with finding a lawyer.

Overview:

The Java_appointment_system project is a Java-based application that allows users to manage appointments. It provides core functionalities such as adding appointments, displaying appointments for a particular day, deleting appointments, and displaying appointments within a specified period of time. The project uses a simple object-oriented design, with different types of appointments (one-time, daily, and monthly) represented by classes that extend a base Appointment class. The value proposition of this project lies in its ability to help users efficiently organize and keep track of their appointments, improving their time management and productivity.

entry.title: Scratch-Teaching
entry.content:
Igniting a Passion for Coding: My Journey Teaching Scratch to Young Minds

The Genesis of a Summer Coding Adventure

From Idea to Implementation: During my high school years, I envisioned a unique project – a Scratch coding course for elementary school students. Driven by my passion for technology and education, I rallied a group of classmates, and together, we embarked on a mission to design and teach this innovative course.

Learning to Teach: Beyond the Lecture Hall

Rethinking Traditional Methods: As we launched the course, I quickly realized that traditional lecture-style teaching, a staple of my own school experience, fell flat in this new setting. The familiar one-way communication approach didn’t resonate with these young, curious minds.

A Shift Towards Interactive Learning

The Power of Engagement: The turning point came when we shifted our strategy. We embraced interactive and hands-on learning – a stark contrast to the usual classroom lectures. This change was not just a new direction but a revelation.

Examples of Interactive Learning:

  1. Collaborative Coding Challenges: We encouraged students to work in teams, turning coding exercises into a shared journey of discovery and problem-solving.
  2. Freedom to Experiment: Allowing the kids to ‘play’ with the code, to try, fail, and try again, was instrumental. It wasn’t about getting it right the first time; it was about exploring and learning from the process.

Witnessing the Transformation

The Impact of Interactive Lessons:

  • Increased Enthusiasm: The classroom buzzed with excitement. Students were no longer passive listeners but active participants, eagerly engaging with the material.
  • Boost in Confidence: As they collaborated and experimented, I saw their confidence in using technology soar. They were no longer intimidated by the idea of coding; instead, they embraced it as a tool for creation and expression.

Personal Growth and Insights

A Lasting Impression: This experience profoundly impacted me. Witnessing firsthand how different educational approaches can ignite or dampen the spark of learning was a lesson I’ll carry with me. It has reshaped my understanding of teaching and its possibilities, especially in the field of technology education.

Conclusion: The Scratch summer course was more than just a teaching assignment; it was a journey of discovery – for my students and myself. It reinforced my belief that when learning is interactive, engaging, and fun, it can transform students’ attitudes and aspirations.

Text Book:

Course Photos:
